maml:description.maml:para: Gets registered volume information
Gets volumes that are registered using the Register-FsVolumeInfo command and are available to the Start-FsCrawlJob command.
Find registered volume information by full, case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory.
Find registered volume information by name of the volume.
Find registered volume information by the name of the drive format.
Find registered volume information by volume guid / serial number
Get all registered volumes.
Find registered volume information by full, case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory.
Find registered volume information by name of the volume.
Find registered volume information by the name of the drive format.
Find registered volume information by volume guid / serial number.
Get all registered volumes.
Case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory to search for.
Describes the registered volume information

command:example.maml:title: Get registered volume that match any of the specified root path names.
Get registered volumes that match any of the specified volume names.
Get registered volume that matches the specified file system names.
Get registered volume that matches the specified volume serial numbers.

maml:description.maml:para: Registers file system volume information
Register file system volume information to be used by the Start-FsCrawlJob command.
The full, case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory.
The name of the file system volume.
The name of the drive format.
The volume UUID or VSN that will be used as the unique identifier for the file system volume.
GReturn registered volume information object.
The full, case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory.
The name of the file system volume.
The name of the drive format.
The volume guid or serial number that will be used as the identifier.
GReturn registered volume information object.
Describes the registered volume information

command:example.maml:title: Register volume info using volume and return volume information object.

maml:description.maml:para: Un-registers file system volume information
Un-registers file system volume information so it is no longer available to the Start-FsCrawlJob command.
The full, case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory for the volume to be unregistered.
The volume guid or serial number that will be used to identify the volume to be unregistered.
The volume information object to be unregistered.
The full, case-sensitive path name of the volume root directory for the volume to be unregistered.
The volume guid or serial number that will be used to identify the volume to be unregistered.
The volume information object to be unregistered.

command:example.maml:title: Un-register volume info using the volume's root path.
Un-register volume info using the volume serial number.
Un-register volume info using a volume information object.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts file system crawl job.
Starts a background job that gathers file system content information.
Root directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcars).
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
Job does not expire automatically.
Optional job name.
Root directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcars).
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The number of minutes to allow crawl to run.
Optional job name.
Root directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcars).
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The date/Time when crawl will be stopped if it has not already completed.
Optional job name.
Literal root directory of the path to be crawled.
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
Job does not expire automatically.
Optional job name.
Literal root directory of the path to be crawled.
The machine-specific unique identifier which identifies the current host system.
Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The number of minutes to allow crawl to run.
Optional job name.

Maximum crawl depth. Default is 512.
Maximum items to crawl. Default is 4,294,967,295.
The date/Time when crawl will be stopped if it has not already completed.
Optional job name.
Root directory of the path to be crawled (supports wildcars).
Literal root directory of the path to be crawled.

command:example.maml:title: Register volume info and start crawl job to run no more than 3 hours.
Register volume info and start crawl job to run until 5AM, if necessary.
Register volume info and start job to crawl 2 different paths.
